intro: Rhabdadenia nervosa, commonly known as the veined rock fig, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and branching stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are often covered in a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss. Rhabdadenia nervosa produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by fleshy, fig-like fruits.
